introduction: In this video, we discuss the three major parts of software engineering interviews: coding, system design, and behavioral interviews. The coding interview focuses on algorithms and data structures, measuring the candidate's IQ and basic skills. System design interviews evaluate the candidate's ability to perform at the task and provide insights into their past data points. Behavioral interviews are subjective and require skilled interviewers to assess the candidate's fit for the company. The most relevant interview for startups is system design, while large organizations prioritize coding interviews. The course covers three sections: fundamentals, high-level design, and machine coding, with live classes for additional content and updates.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Software Engineering Interviews
content: Explanation of the three major parts of software engineering interviews: coding, system design, and behavioral interviews.
Discussion on the importance of understanding the system to perform better and articulate oneself better.
Explanation of the coding interview as an IQ test and measurement of basic skills.
Introduction to system design interviews and their focus on past data points.

sections.title: Section 2: Understanding the System Design Interview
content: Explanation of the system design interview as a way to evaluate a candidate's ability to perform at the task.
Discussion on the importance of past data points in system design interviews.
Explanation of critical incident interviews (CII) and their requirement for experienced interviewers.
Example of a system design interview question and its relevance to the candidate's future performance.

sections.title: Section 3: The Importance of Behavioral Interviews
content: Explanation of the behavioral interview as a subjective and subjective assessment of a candidate's fit for the company.
Discussion on the importance of skilled interviewers in behavioral interviews.
Explanation of how behavioral interviews can help startups and large organizations.
Example of a behavioral interview question and its relevance to the candidate's future performance.

sections.title: Section 4: The Full Process of Software Engineering Interviews
content: Explanation of the full process of software engineering interviews, focusing on the three major parts.
Discussion on how to evaluate a candidate's skills in various areas.
Explanation of how dynamic programming is essential in software engineering interviews.
Example of a game AI question and its relevance to the candidate's future performance.
topics: Full Process of Software Engineering Interviews

sections.title: Section 5: The Course Structure and Content
content: Explanation of the course structure, divided into three sections: fundamentals, high-level design, and machine coding.
Discussion on the importance of understanding deep design concepts in software engineering.
Explanation of the live classes feature and its benefits for keeping up with the latest content and updates.
Example of a high-level design question and its relevance to the candidate's future performance.
